name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"34670680-c9d7-4706-aa00-2a0579d05a33","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Data Operations & Execution","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f7227451-d7e6-4b39-bb86-5ee81a68af01","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods analyze the actual manipulation of data and the invocation of logic. This includes assigning values to variables, creating data structures, calling functions, and returning values from them.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"957366f7-7d4e-4643-a6c0-62eef4598d1e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group is responsible for tracking the "life" of data as it moves through the program. By monitoring how values are created (literals), moved (assignments/calls), and exited (returns), the analyzer builds a map of data flow. These methods ensure that the analyzer knows not just what code exists, but what that code ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"does","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the information it processes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dbdfb33e-9d76-4c03-9a11-8d3afffc3f8d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a2f3f74b-256f-45f3-ace8-ebe1162ab6f4","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function Descriptions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ab5d4d6-9397-42eb-b03b-32867964b85b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":"assign / visit_Assign","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"55220fa1-a372-4835-a971-3643fc46fba8","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Analyzes variable assignment statements (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = 10","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj.prop = val","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"373af8a7-8ee1-431c-acef-64ad3c5cd0dd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"710ef5c9-afaa-4309-b83f-80d6590cc791","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Evaluation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It first visits the right-hand side (RHS) to determine the source of the data.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f69b1e2-1c4e-4262-905b-ee853881adbf","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Targeting:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It identifies the left-hand side (LHS) targets, which could be names, attributes, or complex destructuring (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"a, b = c","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bd6ea785-00c2-4daf-9638-3e3a5194e9d9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Contextual Updating:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Using the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"update","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" helper, it records the assignment. If the assignment happens inside a conditional block, it manages the change as a "deferred" update to ensure proper merging later.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"40d2afae-4a04-4dfa-9415-9efe698e5445","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Call","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5535d914-4e1f-4276-b030-ab766761ec77","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Analyzes function and method call expressions to resolve possible callees, track argument-to-parameter value flow, and update the call graph.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"863a34b6-2a1e-4e31-a119-fd1caeaa0acd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4f37d8ed-bfa7-429d-a76e-994182c39036","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Determines exactly which function or class is being invoked.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"48aa1caa-da23-4f5c-963d-ca7201ef992b","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Mapping:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Binds the values passed in the call site to the internal parameters of the function definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a1cf1883-789c-4208-b2a2-f03d5db9eaf0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Side Effects:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Checks for and applies any modifications the function makes to global states or mutable objects, ensuring the caller's scope is updated after the call returns.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e12c8795-cbca-4a97-b6c5-263aa838fdcf","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_List / visit_Dict","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"34a1d8ad-a29d-44ec-b60d-24317cd16e91","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes collection literals (lists and dictionaries) by creating structured internal models for them.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5a8c8fed-90ba-49a5-b522-b6d49988bcb2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7ea9b651-21f8-41b9-a8a5-8b646263da29","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Structure Tracking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Creates a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"LIST_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"MAP_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and assigns a unique name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<list_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"583b24f1-2686-4c50-b763-6f63f7290029","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Element Modeling:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Instead of just treating them as generic containers, these methods analyze every element/pair inside. They map specific indices or keys to resolved definitions, allowing the analyzer to track that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_list[0]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an Integer or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_dict['name']","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a String.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"970147f3-5f27-4ea6-b3c7-7b93bfe09ad7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":"return / visit_Return / visit_Yield","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"629a9b7b-da12-4617-8088-56586f6ab2f8","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes the exit points of functions and generators.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"23ed3d65-3f1a-44f6-af2c-3638aaf79287","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"26ea314e-fd54-43db-b098-6b492394cefa","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Return Mapping:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Captures the expression being returned and assigns it to a special ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<return>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" variable within the function's scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4cb26580-3c64-41a4-9832-fe3b1fd979ab","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generator Support:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"yield","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it tracks the values yielded, allowing the analyzer to understand what an iterator will produce when looped over elsewhere.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"73337e8a-8768-45fd-9f55-3f479e8aa074","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Flow Tracking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Ensures that the "output" of a function is correctly linked back to its definition so that callers can resolve the result of invoking that function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1129eadf-509f-4a46-a2a6-b268f9014644","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
